info.name: Path of the Defiler
info.description: Arcane Tradition for the Wizard class for the D&D 5e campaign set in the DarkSun setting

sheet.description: Defilers have no remorse in using the power of the land to increase their spells power.

description.p: Starting at 2nd level when you choose this path, when you are standing in an area with living plants, you can drain their energy to power your spells, treating them as if cast with a spell slot one level higher than you actually spent. When you use this feature, all plant life within 5ft of you turns black and withers and you cannot use this feature in an area that has been defiled already.

sheet.description: When you defile in an area with living plants, you treat your spell as if cast with a spell slot one level higher than you actually spent. All plant life within 5ft of you turns black and dies. You cannot use this feature in an area already defiled.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, when you use your Raze feature, you can also cause each creature within 5ft of to make a Constitution saving throw or take 1d6 necrotic damage. If you do, and at least one creature is damaged by this feature, you have advantage on the attack roll of the spell, if it requires one, or else targets of the spell you are casting have disadvantage on their saving throw.

sheet.description: Using Raze now also causes each creature within 5ft of you to make a Constitution saving throw or take 1d6 necrotic damage. If at least one creature is damaged this way you either get advantage on the spell's attack roll or the targets get disadvantage on their saving throws.

description.p: Starting at 10th level, you may use your Raze feature without expending a spell slot. Instead of casting a spell, you regain 2d8 hit points, plus 1d6 hit points for each creature within 5 feet that fails the Constitution saving throw from your Agonizing Raze feature

sheet.description: You can use Agonizing Raze without casting a spell or spending a spell slot, instead getting 2d8 hit points plus 1d6 hit points for every creature within 5ft of you that fails the Constitution saving throw.

description.p: Beginning at 14th level, when you use your Raze feature, you can reroll any number of the spell's damage dice. You must use the second result even if it is lower.

sheet.description: When you use Raze you can reroll once any number of the spell's damage dice, but you must use the second result even if it is lower.
